title: compatibility
content:
The version of photo_manager_image_provider depends on the flutter version and the photo_manager version.
image_provider flutter photo_manager ^1.0.0 “>=2.2.0 <3.14.0” ^2.6.0 ^2.0.0 ^3.14.0 ^2.6.0 Changelog The commit（3.14.0） of flutter remove ImageStreamCompleter.load method.
Since flutter 3.14.0, the photo_manager_image_provider need use 2.0.0 version.
description:

image_provider flutter photo_manager ^1.0.0 “>=2.2.0 <3.14.0” ^2.6.0 ^2.0.0 ^3.14.0 ^2.6.0 Changelog The commit（3.14.0） of flutter remove ImageStreamCompleter.load method.
Since flutter 3.14.0, the photo_manager_image_provider need use 2.0.0 version.

title: Configuring Java Version in photo_manager
content:
To ensure compatibility with older versions of AGP/flutter SDK, photo_manager supports configuring the project’s Java version through configuration files, environment variables, and other methods.
It looks for the Java version in the following order:
Configuration in gradle.properties using the java.version property. The value should be in the format of a Java version number, such as 1.8, 11, 17, 21, etc. Using the JAVA_HOME environment variable, which should point to the installation path of the JDK. Typically, the Java executable is located at $JAVA_HOME/bin/java. Configuration in gradle.properties using the java.home property. Reading the runtime property java.home of the JDK. If none of the above is found, it defaults to using JavaVersion.current(). Steps 4 and 5 should use the JDK configured in the Gradle settings, which is usually the same.
description:

Configuration in gradle.properties using the java.version property. The value should be in the format of a Java version number, such as 1.8, 11, 17, 21, etc. Using the JAVA_HOME environment variable, which should point to the installation path of the JDK.
